author: schone_wizard
content: why does overall stake effectiveness seem to be on a downward trend only?

author: potuz
content: The max effective balance is 32 ETH. Without transfers/withdrawals at some point most staked eth will not be used for securing the network

author: schone_wizard
content: so you're saying because the average balance has grown above 32 and isn't being used to secure per say cuz of the maximum dictated the percentage shows as if the effectiveness goes down?

author: potuz
content: Roughly, the numerator equals the number of validators times 32. The denominator equals the number of validators times 33 (or whatever the average balance is, but it's higher than 32)

author: potuz
content: The numerator will stay roughly like that, while the denominator will increase with rewards

author: sky.cactus
content: This would go against the ethos of Ethereum where pseudoanonymity and censorship resistance are desirable features.

author: sky.cactus
content: People can volunteer to be monitored (just like with PoW and operating an Ethereum node), but they should always have a choice to remain pseudoanonymous if they want.
